Class FileWorks

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pipe42.data.FileWorks

  • public class FileWorks
extends java.lang.Object
    Some special file IO methods to fit this project
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      FileWorks()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFileNames(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String extension)
      When passed an absolute path or a relative local path starting in format "src/.../destination_folder" it will return all files with the specified extension
      java.io.File readFile(java.lang.String filePath)
      Reads a file from the disc with either absolute path or relative path from source root.
      void writeFolder(java.lang.String path)
      Takes a relative path of a folder and writes it to disc example "src/data/myfolder" will write a folder "myfolder" inside the "data" folder
      void writeJsonFile(java.lang.String filename)
      Writes a .json file to the json specific directory
      java.lang.Boolean writeTextFile(java.lang.String filePathAndName, java.lang.String input)
      Writes a text file with an input String with no formatting

    • Method Detail

      • writeTextFile

        public java.lang.Boolean writeTextFile(java.lang.String filePathAndName,
                                       java.lang.String input)
        Writes a text file with an input String with no formatting
        Parameters:
        filePathAndName - file path and name of type String including extension
        input - any input of type String
        Returns:
        true if written, otherwise false

      • getFileNames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getFileNames(java.lang.String path,
                                                          java.lang.String extension)
        When passed an absolute path or a relative local path starting in format "src/.../destination_folder" it will return all files with the specified extension
        Parameters:
        path - absolute or relative path to source, eg /src/some/path
        extension - filter output for files with this specific extension, eg. ".jpg" or ".exe"
        Returns:
        list of file names, otherwise NULL

      • writeFolder

        public void writeFolder(java.lang.String path)
        Takes a relative path of a folder and writes it to disc example "src/data/myfolder" will write a folder "myfolder" inside the "data" folder
        Parameters:
        path - relative folder path to be written

      • readFile

        public java.io.File readFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Reads a file from the disc with either absolute path or relative path from source root. Eg. /src/some/folder/data.json
        Parameters:
        filePath - path to jason file
        Returns:
        file object, or of not existent then NULL

      • writeJsonFile

        public void writeJsonFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Writes a .json file to the json specific directory
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the json file including extension as String
